oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Store Used as Hickory Tree School

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities
Education; Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of an old store used as a school in Hickory Tree, Sullivan County. Wooden structure has vertical boards and a sloping covered porch.
Hickory Tree is a small community in eastern Sullivan County near the Holston River. At the turn of the twentieth century, it was sometimes known as Hemlock.
